intro: Castanopsis tungurrut, commonly known as the Tungurrut chestnut. It is a species of evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. The plant belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, woody fruit capsules. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a leathery texture, while its bark is rough and fissured. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
